pulls.title: Markdown and kramdown fixes
pulls.author: SteveLasker
pulls.body:
Markdown and Kramdown fixes. No content changes.

- Each sentence on its own line for easy PR feedback and editing
- Numbers are always 1, to make insertions and deletions isolated
- Moved the informative text to the top section, letting kramdown do all the reference generation

reviews.author: SteveLasker
reviews.body:
Lots of great content. From a pure formatting perspective, I wasn't sure if "¶" was intended to be kept, or was part of a copy/paste error. 

Kramdown did complain the RFC references were in the appendix but not referenced in the doc. Might want to add the pointers with {{RFC1234}} sprinkled around, then check `make` for any errors for unused references.

comments.body:
intentionally "¶" ?
```suggestion
For instance, IP addresses are considered personal information by the EU and FTC, but not by U.S. federal agencies under the Privacy Act.
Moreover, sometimes, deidentified data can be reidentified, introducing challenges to personal data protection.
```
